title.narrative: ACCESS TO CHILD PROTECTION SERVICES

description.narrative: Community members are able and willing to reject Practice of FGM/C, Child Marriage and Violence Against Children, which contributes to Access To Justice, Birth Registration, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Child Protection And Emergencies, Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Data And Child Protection, Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage), Justice For Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, Eritrean girls and boys in four Zobas have access to quality Basic Education and Child Protection Services

sector.narrative: Administrative data and Information Management System (IMS) including CPIMS+, GBVIMS+, MRMIMS+
Legal and policy framework related to violence, exploitation and abuse
Linking cash to other programs, information and services (information on essential family practices, livelihoods, psycho-social support, etc.)
Social welfare workforce systems strengthening (accreditation, staffing and supervision)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Community members are able and willing to reject Practice of FGM/C, Child Marriage and Violence Against Children

description.narrative: A total of 27,577 community members, including 5,515 adolescents (2,922 girls), actively participated in comprehensive education on sexual and reproductive health and violence against children, to address female genital mutilation (FGM) and underage marriage (UAM), and 1,946 households in two sub-zobas of Northern Red Sea Region (NRS) were reached through FGM community mapping to assess the extent of community willingness and readiness to declare FGM free. Additionally, 3,409 vulnerable families were reached with social assistance (cash and food) through community resources, benefitting 7,866 children (including 2,550 children living with disabilities) to strengthen livelihoods, prevent social stigma and build resilience. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:22/12/2021
